content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

content: I don't understand how sovereignty can be confused with seccession, unless you really don't understand the ideas laid out by the Founding Fathers. The Constitution of the United States and the Tenth Amendment of the United States Constitution clearly allow the states to govern themselves with the exception of the powers delegated to the Federal Government. All this resolution does is reaffirm the state of Texas's rights under the Constitution. Many other states have proposed similar resolutions and I hope they are backed as well. The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.

The Federal government has been overstepping it's bounds for years and the federal law makers need to be "put in check" by the Governors of all of the states, not just Texas. When the Liberals on this board joke about Texas's seccession it shows how ignorant they really are about the Constitution and the powers that it allows and expressly limits. This resolution isn't funny, it actually makes me sad. It makes me sad for our country that a state has to reaffirm it's rights specifically addressed in the United States Constitution. If our Founding Fathers could see our country today, I wonder if they would have even considered a revolution at all.
